alert.note: Alert for Greene; Perry; Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 6:43AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw, northwestern Washington, northwestern Clarke, east central Perry, Wayne and northern Greene Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 642 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Crandall to 5 miles east of Clara to 4 miles northeast of Beaumont. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Chatom, Clara, Tibbie, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Fruitdale, Coffeeville, Gilbertown and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
